newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SOCCER-GOTHENBERG PAYS SIX MLN SKR FOR ANDERSSON.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-GOTHENBERG PAYS SIX MLN SKR FOR ANDERSSON.

text.p: Swedish soccer club IFK Gothenberg have bought Robert Andersson from Halmstad BK for six million crowns ($748,000) ($748,000), the highest ever transfer fee in Sweden for a Swedish player, newspapers said on Saturday.
Tabloid Expressen said negotiations over Andersson, 26, started three weeks ago and were finalised on Thursday night.

Halmstad chairman Stig Nilsson said the club had earlier turned down an offer of three million crowns ($374,000) from a German club for Andersson whose contract does not run out until the end of this year but this price was too good to miss.
Andersson's first match in his three-year contract with Gothenberg will be on August 10 when the western Swedish team meets Vasteras.
"I think it's better to play in Gothenberg than to sit on the benches in Germany," Andersson told Expressen.
"If I am lucky Gothenberg could be a springboard for a professional career," he told Sweden's other national tabloid, Aftonbladet.
Sweden's previous highest transfer fee was a two million crown ($248,667) payment by Gothenberg for Niclas Andersson of Halmstad.
